name: FEZ
description: Explore a 2D retrofuturistic world by rotating in the third dimension. The minimalistic style, bright vibrant colors and dynamic lighting bring the 16-bit era into the future.

name: Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP
description: Laid back adventure in a bronze age mountain wilderness. Dreamy soft colors in a living world affected by moon phases.

name: Shovel Knight: Treasure Trove
description: Classic action adventure with an 8-bit retro aesthetic, taking the looks of a modern NES game.

name: Hyper Light Drifter
description: Top-down action in a sci-fi world that radiates light and warmth. Using a colorful palette and kaleidoscopic neon yet setting a grim ambiance.

name: Owlboy
description: Explore a detailed steampunk world in the clouds. With it's range of endearing animations and expressions the world and it's characters come to life.

name: Stardew Valley
description: Manage a farm from a top-down perspective and engage with a charming and cheerful world in 16-bit.

name: Paul Robertson
description: Australian, creating cute, sometimes cosmic and psychedelic, and sometimes weird nightmarish pixel art.

name: Syosa
description: Japanese, girlish style using bright and organic color palletes creating cute humans and animals.

name: Thomas Feichtmeir
description: Australian, dark and mature: fan of knights, dinosaurs, pirates, epic beasts, anatomy and history as well as everything twisted and weird.

name: Toyoi Yuuta
description: Australian, capturing small animated scenes of everyday life in unsaturated colors.

name: Aseprite
description: Open source, paid with trial, works on Linux, macOS and Windows. Awesome UI with a lot of nifty tools to ease pixel art creation.

name: Pixen
description: Paid, works on macOS and iOS. Superb OS integration, create pixel art on a tablet using pressure-sensitive drawing.

name: Pro Motion
description: Paid with trial, works on Windows. Advanced features tailored to creating pixel art for games.

name: GIMP
description: Open source and free, works on Linux, macOS and Windows. Not specifically for creating pixel art but is more than capable to do so.

name: Piskel
description: Open source and free, works in the browser, on Linux, macOS and Windows. Easy to try out in the browser saving sprites online.
